extendedIngredients.name: butter lettuce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 head butter lettuce, leaves separated into cups

extendedIngredients.name: chicken breast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 pound ground chicken breast (I prefer thighs)

extendedIngredients.name: chiles
extendedIngredients.originalString: Minced fresh chiles, Jalapeño or Fresno (amount is up to your level of spiciness)
metaInformation: (amount is up to your level of spiciness)

extendedIngredients.name: mint
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 handful of cilantro and/or mint, cut into chiffonade

recipes.title: Crushing On Jaden Hair of Steamy Kitchen and Thai Lettuce Wraps

winePairing.pairingText: Asian on the menu? Try pairing with Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese
productMatches.description: Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese is made from late-harvestedRiesling grapes in the middle Mosel Valley of Germany. These grapes hang into late Autumn and ripen such that they produce a rich, full-bodied white wine. This is an elegant Riesling that offers a palate of different stone and tree fruit notes such as peach and apricot. It is luscious and full-bodied with a long and fresh finish.An ideal dinner Riesling and also can be enjoyed withriper, aged cheeses and spicy cuisine due to its enhancedcomplexity.Blend: 100% Riesling

recipes.instructions: Heat a wok or large sauté pan over high heat. When hot, swirl in 1 tablespoon of the oil and add the chicken. Use your spatula to break up the meat and spread out over the surface of the pan. cook until browned, about 3 minutes. Push the ground chicken to one side of the pan and swirl in the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil. To the oil, add the shallots, red onion, garlic and fresh chiles and sauté the aromatics until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the fish sauce, lime juice and soy sauce.Serve with lettuce cups and herbs.

steps.step: Heat a wok or large sauté pan over high heat. When hot, swirl in 1 tablespoon of the oil and add the chicken. Use your spatula to break up the meat and spread out over the surface of the pan. cook until browned, about 3 minutes. Push the ground chicken to one side of the pan and swirl in the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil. To the oil, add the shallots, red onion, garlic and fresh chiles and sauté the aromatics until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the fish sauce, lime juice and soy sauce.
Serve with lettuce cups and herbs.
